attributes.description: Time required to detect and act against ice formation.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Compliance with international aviation icing safety standards.
attributes.name: complianceStandards

attributes.description: System capability to operate effectively under single subsystem failure.
attributes.name: redundancyCapability

designScenario.description: The Anti-Ice and De-Ice System is designed to ensure the safety and aerodynamic efficiency of an aircraft by preventing or removing ice formation on critical components such as wings, engine intakes, and control surfaces. The system incorporates advanced sensing mechanisms to detect ice build-up, activates anti-icing measures proactively, and utilizes dual-mode functionality combining thermal heating and fluid application systems for de-icing.
designScenario.name: Anti-Ice and De-Ice System

details.description: The system must automatically detect ice formation using temperature, moisture, and visual sensors.
The system shall activate anti-icing mechanisms upon detection of conditions conducive to ice formation.
The system shall maintain surface conditions to prevent duty cycle increases beyond system tolerance during operation.
The de-icing mechanism shall remove accretions within a five-second window.
The system must include multiple fail-safe redundancies to ensure operational endurance despite subsystem dysfunction.
The system should possess in-built diagnostics to alert of potential performance degradation.
The system interfaces must be user-friendly for maintenance operatives, with graphical and textual diagnostics provided.
Components should be modular and easily exchangeable to reduce operational downtime during replacements or upgrades.

relationships.description: Data flows from sensors to the computing unit for analysis and decision-making.
Heating elements receive activation triggers from the control unit.
The fluid application submodules transfer de-icing solution to discharge outlets.

systemComponents.description: Core unit processing inputs from sensors and directing actions.
systemComponents.name: Central Processing Unit

systemComponents.description: Sensors distributed across protective surfaces monitoring freezing conditions.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Network

subComponents.description: Devices for temperature measurement and evaluation.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensors

subComponents.description: Devices detecting atmospheric moisture conducive to ice.
subComponents.name: Moisture Sensors

systemComponents.description: Parts heating surface areas to counteract freezing.
systemComponents.name: Heating Elements

subComponents.description: Heaters ensuring ice clearance on engine intakes.
subComponents.name: Engine Heating Units

systemComponents.description: Structurally conveyor system distributing de-icing fluid.
systemComponents.name: Fluid Delivery Assembly

subComponents.description: Pump system for propelling de-icing fluid.
subComponents.name: Pumping System

subComponents.description: Regulated valves discharging fluid across surfaces.
subComponents.name: Outlet Valves

comments.body: The De-Icing System is designed to prevent ice accumulation on critical components such as wings and engine inlets.

rag_context: De-Icing System的所有信息和规格说明包括：操作温度范围为-20°C至+20°C，响应时间为检测和减少冰积累在5秒内，能源类型为Bleed Air / Electric，认证标准符合FAA和EASA对防冰系统的要求，冗余级别为双冗余控制路径。该系统旨在防止飞机关键部位如机翼、发动机进气口和控制面积积冰。通过使用主动加热元件、受控除冰液系统和先进传感器网络的组合，确保冰雪不会影响飞机的空气动力学和安全性。此外，系统还提供实时监测，并利用温度和湿度数据的预测能力主动参与防冰措施。
